section.heading: Purpose and Scope.
section.text: This chapter describes the procedures of the support enforcement agency to locate a parent to establish and enforce the duty of support and for other purposes allowed by federal law.

para.text: In this chapter, the following terms have the meanings indicated.
Terms Defined.
"Authorized individual" means a judge or attorney empowered to act on behalf of the State to:
Make or enforce a child custody determination;
Make or enforce a visitation determination; or
Prosecute a parental kidnapping case.
"Federal Parent Locator Service" means the Parent Locator Service operated by the federal Office of Child Support Enforcement.
"Parent" means the natural or adoptive mother or father.
"Parental kidnapping" means an act by which a parent has taken physical custody of a child with the knowledge that another individual is the lawful custodian.
"State Parent Locator Service" means the unit of the Administration that assists local child support enforcement agencies in locating parents.

The support enforcement agency shall make reasonable attempts to locate parents including accessing information in the State Parent Locator Service and the Federal Parent Locator Service for the purpose of establishing, modifying, or enforcing a support obligation.
The support enforcement agency shall complete all location efforts within 75 days of determining that location is necessary.
The Administration shall maintain a State Parent Locator Service.
The State Parent Locator Service shall solicit information from available sources to locate an absent parent upon receipt of a request from:
A support enforcement agency; or
Maryland Central Registry.

The State Parent Locator Service shall be the conduit to the Federal Parent Locator Service for the purpose of locating a parent for enforcing custody or visitation at the request of an authorized individual.
The U.S. Department of Health and Human Services administers a Federal Parent Locator Service.
The Federal Parent Locator Service conducts an information search upon receipt of a request from:
State Parent Locator Service; or
Support enforcement agency.

section.heading: Child Custody, Visitation, or Parental Kidnapping.

para.text: The Federal Parent Locator Service is available to authorized individuals for the purpose of locating a parent or child.
The State Parent Locator Service shall:
Request location information from the Federal Parent Locator Service when the conditions listed in §A of this regulation are met; and
Send information furnished by the Federal Parent Locator Service to the authorized individual.

section.heading: State Case Registry of Records.
section.text: The Administration shall maintain a State case registry of child support orders which contains information as required by federal and State law. This regulation does not, and may not be construed to, impose any duty on any unit of the State government other than the Administration.
